sentences.en: American humor is founded largely on hyperbole.

sentences.en: But the hyperbole is fast becoming reality.

sentences.en: Different criteria result in different categories of hyperbole.

sentences.en: Hyperbole and understatement are two chief rhetorical figures in English language.
sentences.cn: 夸张与含蓄陈述是英语中两种主要的修辞手段.

sentences.en: Instead, recruitment is often an orgy of hyperbole.
sentences.cn: 而事实上, 招聘常常是没边儿的夸张.

sentences.en: It was not hyperbole to call it the worst storm in twenty years.

sentences.en: Journalists, often guilty of hyperbole, have struggled for once to capture the rawness of the politics.

sentences.en: Mourinho was modest afterwards, acknowledging the wild swings in hyperbole to which the media are prone.
sentences.cn: 穆里尼奥此后谦虚了些, 回应了媒体态度夸张的转向.

sentences.en: Mr Murdoch was unwise to indulge in adolescent hyperbole.

sentences.en: Prochazka loved to regale his friends with hyperbole and excess.
sentences.cn: 普罗恰兹卡喜欢用夸张、过激的话与朋友逗乐.

sentences.en: Quantitative hyperbole is common figure of speech in both Chinese and English.
sentences.cn: 数量夸张是汉语和英语所共有的修辞格.

sentences.en: Such hyperbole might seem reminiscent of the dotcom bubble.

sentences.en: There's nothing wrong a little confidence, even the point of near hyperbole.
sentences.cn: 有点信心并无什么过错, 甚至夸张一点也并无大碍.
